content: Great game, great digital version.
Good game, just a bit woke!
Excellent, fun, great port of the tabletop. I can't figure out how to download the dlc though? May just have to pick it up IRL!

I bought both dlc's, but they are not unlocked in the game. I already reported it through a link in the game, but I haven't heard anything yet. I want this resolved cause 7 euro is a lot for something that doesn't work. I do like the game overall and just wanted more content.
DLC Not included

New post: After buying a pixel 4a, the game runs great. Completely worth the cost, but beware that it doesn't appear to work on older phones. == Old post == I was really looking forward to this one. I love the physical version. However all I got was the two splash screens and then a black screen for two minutes. Uninstalled and reinstalled - same result. Galaxy S5 Neo.
replyContent: Hi, we fixed the problem you were having with version 1.4.5, released in February. We updated our response so you would know, sorry if you missed it! The game indeed works on older phones. Thanks!

content: Game seems smooth and well made, the gameplay style just wasn't for me though.

Base game is fun and addictive. Forest of Shadows DLC has amazing content but standard healing potion only clears one damage instead of 2 or 3 in base game. Made it virtually impossible to get to boss without dying first. Frustrating.
Excellent interface design and very fun game play.
Fairly faithful to the original game. Simple concept but makes up for a fairly lengthy game.

The game itself is perfect - mechanics and play is super satisfying. Exactly like the card game without spreading everything out on the floor! Recently, however, Google Play Games downright HARRASSES me to install. I gave in and installed it, and then I kept getting really annoying and unwanted game updates and achievements. I turned off everything I could in GPG but still got popups. I'd honestly score this 5 stars if the game dev would do something to stop this constant annoyance.
replyContent: Hi there! If you'd like, please contact us at support@handelabra.com so we can help try to resolve the issue. Thank you!

content: Fun solo experience. I think it's better than the actual cardgame.
Great game for what it is.
I cant play for some reason like after 15 seconds I get kicked out of the game and I cant even see the game because I get kicked out before I get into the game
replyContent: Hi there! If you'd like, please contact us at support@handelabra.com so we can help try to resolve the issue. Thank you!

content: Great game!

Very much enjoying the roguelike nature of the game, and especially the campaign for replayability. Haven't had any issues playing. Great sale price for the game! The DLC/IAP are on sale as well on Steam. Will they be on sale on Android?
Lots of fun! I would love to have sync over multiple devices though.

Really buggy. Sometimes skills won't activate, other times the skill will activate but not let me select any dice to pay for the skill, leaving me stuck on a screen where all I can do is quit. Also the randomizer isn't great. I ran into 3 ethereals back to back on the first floor. Artwork is nice but the gameplay is too frustrating
replyContent: Hi there! If you'd like, please contact us at support@handelabra.com so we can help try to resolve the issue. Thank you!

content: Great port. I bought shadows expansion too. They did screw up the rules though, you loose time both before and after each door which makes the game much more difficult than the card game i own.
replyContent: Hi there! We work with the original creator to make sure the rules are working properly to the game maker's design. If you feel something is happening in error, please contact us at support@handelabra.com so we can help try to resolve the issue. Thank you!

content: It's fun, but it seems like when you spend two diced to get one black die it almost is always a one, is anyone else getting that?
Great roguelike action in boardgame style. Gives you enough choices to not be forced into one play style.
I don't have the physical game, but having played this app version is definitely convincing me to get the physical copy as well as the upcoming One Deck Galaxy.

Just downloaded this into my Galaxy S20 Plus and parts of it are unusable. I was playing as a warrior and trying to use the Heroic Feat. When tapping on it I can see the message Use Heroic Feat in the background, but it does not activate no matter how many times I tap the button. I had similar experiences trying to use a potion and activating skills. It is a really good game, but this app does not seem to work very well.
replyContent: Hi there! If you'd like, please contact us at support@handelabra.com so we can help try to resolve the issue. Thank you!

content: Purchased this with all the other Handelabra games because they are great - this has a lovely dice mechanic with a rewarding XP system to boot, so replay is a joy. Another thoroughly excellent title and worth the money for both game and DLC alike.
Poop
A great adaption of the card game. Also, a great way to learn the mechanics of the card game.

I've held off on getting this game for a long time because of all the negative reviews associated with controls. I'm happy to say that the dev's fixed this issue and I've had a smooth experience the whole time. The game itself is really enjoyable and a perfect fit for mobile.
Very difficult to read the text on mobile due to text size mainly but also poor color choices.
Don't like it, too confusing. Just doesn't seem to flow.

Decent game, I'd like it a lot more of there was a LAN type co-op function so two people could play through a dungeon together each on their own devices. Otherwise it turns into one person just pressing all the buttons and the other just kind of chillin and not really doing anything.
I like the exploration and feeling of progression aspects of dungeon crawlers - this game tries to emulate that but just feels needlessly grindy before you are able to mitigate bad dice rolls.
Excellent adaptation of the physical game. Nice, quick, fun and challenging.

Seems like it could be a good game, but tapping everything 3 times to get it to register is frustrating. From reviews it seems like many others have this issue, and it's not something I've experienced in other apps (can only guess it is to do with checking if the user is trying to swipe between screens), so hopefully they can patch soon.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for letting us know. We've just released an update with a fix for the problem. Let us know at http://handelabra.com/contact if you have any further trouble. Thanks!

content: Will change my rating once it becomes relatable, seeing as I've already pissed away money. Add male heroes or keep the 1 star.
For a digital release of a board game I expect something really different.
Good game would love to see the ads go away.
replyContent: Hi there! If you'd like, please contact us at support@handelabra.com so we can help try to resolve the lagging issue. Thank you! :)

content: Really like this app, it's helping me understand the physical version much better. It is a little buggy with tapping. Also, in portrait mode, it would be nice if you could see what skills you have while in a room, without having to swap screens. Otherwise it's great on a tablet. Keep improving!
replyContent: Hi, we've just released an update with a fix for the problem. Let us know at http://handelabra.com/contact if you have any further trouble. Thanks!

content: I'm a huge fan of the physical version of this game and really wanted to enjoy this adaptation. But it feels REALLY buggy. I have to tap multiple times to get things to register. Sometimes it has to be a double tap, sometimes a tap and hold, sometimes just frequent taps until it proceeds. I don't have this issue with any other games/applications so surely it isn't just my device. I sadly just got it refunded. Edit: I re-purchased and landscape mode works better. Still not perfect but better.
replyContent: Hi, we've just released an update with a fix for the problem. Let us know at http://handelabra.com/contact if you have any further trouble. Thanks!

content: Just like the card game. love it!

The game plays fine and is a good adaptation. However, I just bought on my phone and now I can't download it on my tablet without having to purchase it again. I've not seen this before. Edit: Issue got fixed ! Thanks!
replyContent: Hi there! You should be able to share content you've already purchased on the same store across devices using the same store. There is an issue with this currently for some devices, please reach out to us at support@handelabra.com so we can assist you. Thank you!

content: The email response was delayed but helpful. Thank you for the assistance. Hopefully a patch comes out to fix DLC sharing between devices without the system consuming the DLC and rendrering it non existent. On the game itself, One deck dungeon is a great rogue like game of luck mitigation. Touch controls can be wonky sometimes, but overall the mechanics are enjoyable. It's one of the better solo tabletop experiences, and a solid dice chucker to add to your app collection.
replyContent: Hi, we've just released an update with a fix for the problem. Let us know at http://handelabra.com/contact if you have any further trouble. Thanks!

content: I don't regret buying this THREE TIMES

Hey love the table top and the digital but I have one problem. I bought the shadows and the 2 $.99 dlcs but for some reason i dont have access to either. I double checked my bank account and its good on my end.
replyContent: Hi there! If you'd like, please contact us at support@handelabra.com or the Google Play store to try and help resolve the issue. Thank you!

content: Why do i have to hit a button soooo many times to get it to register? Fun aspects but rough ui and tutorial
replyContent: Hi, we've just released an update with a fix for the problem. Let us know at http://handelabra.com/contact if you have any further trouble. Thanks!

content: RNG is garbage. You've been warned. Uninstaller after 5 minutes. No enjoyment at all. Waste of 7 bucks
This is a really good game, nice dice macanics and I love the monsters
Love the table top version and this is a perfect version of it. Plus way easier to play solo.
Good,except the black dice rolls when trading in 2 other dice is enough to make me not want to play. ALWAYS a 1 or 2 out of 6.
replyContent: Hi Brad, thanks for playing! According to the rules of the game, when you convert two dice to a heroic die, the heroic die gets the value of the lowest of the two dice. It is not rolled. So if you want a higher value, you need to convert higher value dice to begin with.

content: I normally would have put this at a 4 or 5 but I went and bought the forest of shadows dlc and for 1 it didnt carry over to my samsung tablet and 2 my phone decoded to remove it too i dont know what's going on but I have reached out and this is very concerning given the fact there is no way to restore purchases
replyContent:
Hi Joshua,

Hopefully we have responded to your message reaching out by now, but if not please reach out again so we can look at the issue. There is a way to restore purchases and you are able to share content across devices using the same store. Let us know if you have questions!

content: This is a pretty good game! I've wanted to play the table top version, but saw this on the Android market Soni picked it up. Only issue I see is the statistics in how dice roll. Black dice (for the rogue at least) seem to roll 1's at a MUCH higher rate than 1out of 6. Die probability should NOT be altered just because there is a down side if you roll a 1. Other than that I like it so far, but don't think it is worth a hefty $6.99, especially with more un lockable content that requires more cost.
Great version of the board game.
I have the physical dice game of this and by all accounts it's pretty well dead on. A neat little game with cool mechanics.
Very difficult but a lot of fun if you can deal with losing regularly.
Great android version of gerat card game :)
Great game - like having the cards with me all the time.

I liked this game enough to own the steam and physical versions. However I can't recommend this version unless they fix the touch controls. They often don't respond. Double clicking to view a card is a nightmare. I think the game is trying to figure out if you're swiping or clicking and guessing incorrectly. When viewing hero cards, the card goes black when selected. Seems like something isn't working. Maybe it's supposed to snow the campaign progress or stats for that character.
replyContent: Hi, we've just released an update with a fix for the problem. Let us know at http://handelabra.com/contact if you have any further trouble. Thanks!

content: I will buy the board game coz of this! Thank you

The only bad thing I can say about this is ever since I've installed it I haven't felt the need to bust out the physical game. I do miss chucking the dice, but then again no need to pack everything away (not that ODD is hard to clean up). More mobile games like this please where I don't feel like the devs are just on a whale hunt!

The interface is just a nightmare. You tap a card and screen switches orientations, then you swipe to look at something and you've got pop-up dialogs just frozen in place with no way to close them. I wanted to enjoy this, but I was struggling to parse what was happening on screen way too often.
replyContent: Hi there! If you'd like, please contact us at support@handelabra.com so we can help try to resolve the issue. Thank you!

content: I really enjoy playing this game. The game mechanic is intriguing as well as challenging. It seems near impossible to beat it with only one hero, but two heros have a chance. I haven't been able to defeat a boss yet, but I'm getting better.
It's an okay game but it's just not for me. I felt it was too bland.
Fun game, love the table top version, helped me get the rules down since I tend to forget them when playing in meatspace.

It'd be nice if it let you actually use all of your dice after covering the armor box. I have died due to having 14 sword on my dice with sword challenge boxes left and it would not let me but my die on anything but the armor block so it turned into 25/12 and I died. PoS game.
replyContent: Hi there! If you'd like, please contact us at support@handelabra.com so we can help try to resolve the issue. Thank you!

content: My favorite
Its an excellent game. Just far too difficult.

I own and play the physical games quite a bit and this is a very faithful adaptation. Its brutally hard and sometimes unfair with luck playing a major role. This is by design as classic roguelikes have always shared these traits. If you need a fair and balanced game experience, rogues are not for you. However if, like me you enjoy high stakes and high risk- vs. -reward games that feel AWESOME when you beat them 1 out of 10+ times. Give this a go and you wont be dissapointed!

Excellent. I own both card games physical. Was abit tentative about buying this based on Google reviews alone. Glad I did. Runs great very faithful to the tabletop version. Like the all time stats detail. Controls aren't as bad as some reviews lead to believe had a few moments but doesn't detract from gameplay. Turned music off wasn't helping my gameplay. Won first game against dragon on veteran... Brill XD

This game seems fun and I would love to play more but no matter who I play or how I play I can never get past the first level because defying all odds 80% of the time I roll 5/7 1s on my dice and die within a few encounters. If I owned these dice IRL I would have burned them and cursed the company that made them.

This game is one of my favourites on Android. It combines RPG elements with a nice amount (for me) of randomness, the individual runs are of an almost perfect length and the many characters and bosses mean that it doesn't get too samey. The only negative thing I had to say about it has been fixed with version 1.4.5, since it is now possible to play in landscape mode on the phone, allowing the same quick controls and great overview as on the PC. Thumbs up for that :D
replyContent: Version 1.4.5 is now live and has an option to use landscape UI on your phone now. Thanks!

content: tnx devs. game fixed. 4 stars for the 9.99 dlc.
replyContent:
Hi there! If you'd like, please contact us at support@handelabra.com so we can help try to resolve the issue. Thank you!

EDIT: Version 1.4.5 is now live and should fix start-up and crash issues! Thank you for your patience.

content: it sucks that progress doesn't transfer between devices.
Fun

Awesome Solotaire Dungeon Crawl w/ Buggy and Annoying (but pretty) UI. Love this game to death and I have the physical version as well. The only problem, and it's a big one, is that the game is awful at registering double and single taps. Half the time, when you tap on something, nothing happens, or the UI acts as if you are dragging the screen. Double tapping can help with getting the taps to register, but sometimes even that doesn't work. Still very with playing, in my opinion.
replyContent: Hi, we've just released an update with a fix for the problem. Let us know at http://handelabra.com/contact if you have any further trouble. Thanks!

content: Faithful adaptation of the tabletop card game. Plus you can play multiplayer on one phone!

I love this game. I love trying to work out the odds of taking a gamble. I love using the skills to manipulate the dice rolls. But oh boy do I rage when I get a bad roll that ruins a previously great run.

Near flawless port of the boardgame. Cannot rate it higher though, as I have mixed feelings about the game itself. Because it feels too repetitive for my taste and because I'm dubitative about introducing grinding in a boardgame.
I enjoy this game.. it seems pretty hard at first but as u start getting more skills things get easier. I own both tabletop versions and have been playing this much more just due to convenience.
Love it! A great game and virtual representation of the real game.
replyContent: Hi there! If you'd like, please contact us at support@handelabra.com so we can help try to resolve the issue. Thank you! :)

content: This game is a good adaption of the card game. Unfortunately, it suffers from a lack of unique creatures per boss. Most of the same traps and monsters are encountered. In that limited creature set there are 5 creatures u never want to fight. The boss encounters force the player to roll nothing but 1s on about 70% of their dice. Faced the lich and 7 of my 10 dice were 1s in all 3 rounds. Pay to win if you purchase some of the op characters. Meh.
replyContent: Hi Jim! Thank you for the feedback. Rolls are made with a standard random number generator and DLC characters are only to add a variety of new content to the game, not pay to win. Your odds of victory do not change with different characters. If you'd like, please reach out to us at support@handelabra.com for any questions or concerns!

content: Works well on my LG G4. Only annoyance is my battery goes like mad that I need to manually kill the app just to be on the safe side. The interface "mostly worked" at first, but after a few games, everything works as it should. As implied on the previous paragraphs, the game does save and suspend your game, where you can resume at any later point. You don't need internet access to run the game, but it does require internet for Google's achievements. One are where you don't have "all the info all the time" is if you're in an encounter, you won't be able to access the dungeon screen. Rule book is fully accessible, even during a game, but you may still want to ask questions online, or have someone who knows the game on hand to cover "those few questions" that may trip you up.
Won't even load.
replyContent:
Hi there! If you'd like, please contact us at support@handelabra.com so we can help try to resolve the issue. Thank you! :) 

EDIT: Version 1.4.5 is now live and should fix start-up and crash issues! Thank you for your patience.

content: Great game, very true to the board game! Would rate 5 stars, however one major issue I have with this is that I purchased it using my phone along with all of the individual DLCs except for the forest one. When I got access to my tablet at home, I downloaded the game again. I was expecting that all my purchases would be restored to the new device, like their other games. Was shocked to find that they wanted me to purchase the same DLC again to be able to use it on my tablet!!
replyContent: If you are using the same platform (Android to Android, iOS to iOS) you do not need to purchase the content again. It may appear that way, but you are able to redownload content by restoring purchases as long as you're signed in to the same account used to originally make the purchases. Contact us at support@handelabra.com for more assistance!

content: Bought this game because I enjoy the card version. Fun game overall. The controls are a bit touchy (in a sense)... Well, not touchy (quite literally). It takes a long time and a lot of frustration to actually click on anything. When trying to use a skill or potion I find myself tapping on and around the box to no avail. Eventually something will go after toggling between screen, but then the skill or potion use doesn't always register as being clicked. Good game, frustrating glitches.
replyContent: Hi, we've just released an update with a fix for the problem. Let us know at http://handelabra.com/contact if you have any further trouble. Thanks!

content: Used to play it on MEmu emulator. Doesn't works anymore on it sadly, just shows a black screen after the first logos. The game was good though.

content: better!
$10.00 for 1 expansion DLC!? That is outrageous when the base game only costs $7 Greedy greedy developers.

What motivates your interest? This may work as a tabletop game, but as a videogame it is just too dry, basic, and lacking content to hold your attention for long. This is essentially yahtzee with a fantasy skin rather than a puzzle/RPG. Similarly, the price may compare favourably to the physical game, but not compared to other apps. You can get a lot more bang for your buck elsewhere. If you came to this game this via Sentinels, forget it. There's nothing like the same level of complexity.
High cost, even higher with the real money locked content. The game itself isn't that great to begin with either. Pretty disappointing all around.
replyContent: Hi there! Any DLC are expansion content, the base game comes with all the same content as the original tabletop game.  We're sorry we couldn't provide a fun experience, but thank you for giving us a try! If you have any questions, feel free to contact us at support@handelabra.com

content: Excellent TPK simulator. Really captures the feel of that a-hole DM who's goal in life is to make his "friends" cry.
Great game. Very good port of the board game.
Great adaptation of the board game!
It's great on pc but on mobile it's not so great the screen cant turn sideways for me, and it was hard for me to just read the text

content: Amazing
Great game- i really hope to see more expansions soon!!!

i wanna like this game but its way to complicated. straight from the getgo the wording is awful and makes very little sense. if the game was free i wouldnt mind just playing til i figure it out but since i have limited time for a refund i cant invest into it. looking at the pics and the gameplay it looks like a highly addictive and fun game but i just cant figure it out. maybe in the future ill try it again
sucky

I loved this game. Its easy to jump in and out of which is what i look for in a mobile game. The progression system really makes this game worth it. Only wish it had cloud save. Don't know what I'm going to do when i get a new phone. Transferring progress seems like a headache. Totally a must buy game still though

content: Awesome

This game is awesome. I was looking for a single player RPG in board game format, and I bought the physical version a while back. I put off learning how to play, and didn't end up playing the game until months later when I found the digital version on the play store. After a few games, I was hooked! Between character classes, campaigns, and dlc there is a ton of replayability. Can't wait to play the physical version with friends!
This is the game I find myself playing the most.

love this game! every challenge is mini puzzle in itself, trying to figure out how to get all the dice on the spaces with the skills you have is fun. taking away one star for how slow the game runs... so slow at times... hoping there will be a update soon to correct this, then I'll add the star back. thanks for a great game otherwise...Edit: since the update games runs great, definitely worth 5 stars and a purchase from anyone looking for a great game!
replyContent: Update: Version 1.4.1 is now available with a fix for the slowdown problem. Thanks for playing and have fun!

content: I have never played a game where the dice seem weighted towards ones and twos. This game seems to have a disproportionately high amount of "random" low rolls.
replyContent: Hey there! Thanks for the feedback. We use s standard number generator to randomize dice rolls. We'd be happy to help see if there's a potential bug happening so we can work to resolve it. Feel free to message us at support@handelabra.com with so we can take a look!

content: The updates fixed a lot of my problems I've had with the game. There are still a few things here and there that are minor annoyances. I just had a game where I lost due to 2 damage being done (one per player) and I had two potions still.

content: Great game, only ... it does not have simple Google cloud save. Which immediately takes off 2 stars. content: This seems like a great game. A little more polish would be nice. Also there is a glitch where the trading two die for a heroic die will almost always (19/20 times for me) give you a 1 (the other time was a 2).
replyContent: Hi Thomas! When trading in a heroic die it will always result in the lowest of the two dice traded in (ex: trading in a 5 and a 3 will result in a 3 heroic die, trading in a 3 and a 1 will result in a 1, etc). If this was not what was experienced, send us an email to support@handelabra.com so we can take a look!

content: If you want to get your nerd on this is a good way to do it. Keep in mind though, this game hates you. It will give you 1's when you need 6's and destroy your strategy in a matter of seconds. What makes this game special though is that it's worth playing in spite of the frustration it can cause. It feels great to roll 6's just when you need them and to finally beat the dungeon bosses. I already own the game on Steam and when I found out there was a mobile version, I had to have it.

content: It's exactly what you want for an app version of a tabletop game. This is a perfect game to have digitally. Everything runs fast and smoothly on my Pixel 2.

This is a REALLY fun dice-rolling game, not a card game really. There are RPG aspects both in-game (leveling up, gaining skills and increasing attributes) and after every game in that you can make the character you start with slightly better in a ton of different ways. There are a plethora of different characters and dungeons along with an expansion that pretty much doubles the amount of content in the game.  HIGHLY recommended.

The newly released phone version is little buggy, but a solid port of one of my favorite boardgames. The music is choppy on my phone, and my biggest complaint: You have to swipe too far! It's a nitpick, but I feel like I'm fighting with the interface when I try to swipe to another screen in the game. You have to drag your finger more than halfway across the screen. Also, interface buttons seem hard to press. I have to tap a couple times to get the buttons to register. Otherwise great game!

really buggy and slow . click wait 3 or 4 seconds for response. needs a lot of optimising done to not be very frustrating on android . I play a lot of app board games and this is the worst I have encountered for rhis

content: I love this game! It is a faithful representation of the card game, which is on of the best solitare games I have ever played. Works great with two players as well. It really captures the dungeon crawl feel.
Game is great, GUI needs performance tuning and redesign

Great port from the table top game.  A very fun and addictive game once you understand how to play.  Some things seem a little glitchy, but not so much as to prevent play, generally it just needs an extra tap or two to get what you need.  I am subtracting 1 star at this time because I consider the game to be slightly unfair in that the dice have a tendency to roll low.  After 40 games, here is my dice distribution:  1: 754, 2: 786, 3: 781, 4: 738, 5: 723, 6: 682.  1,2 and 3 come up more often than 4,5,6 which makes games harder to win in an already hard to win game.  If they fix the rng to give a more uniform dice distribution, I will give back the star.  This game is definitely a lot of fun and worth giving it a try.

Very glitchy game. Extremely leggy to the point it is unplayable. Not worth the money, considering how broken the game is. Some of the skills will not work. Also dice rolls need to be more randomized. The release of the last expansion, my rolls are about half of 1s and 2s. Game is now pretty unplayable. Board game is so much better.

A fascinating mixture of stripped to the essentials rogue like dungeon explorer and puzzle game. Based on a card and dice game the monsters / traps are cards with several challenge boxes that need covering with dice of appropriate types and values. Uncovered challenges have consequences (typically lost health and/or time). The heroes in the party affect both the type and quantity of dice available along with how much damage can be sustained. Successful encounters yield rewards of items (dice), skills (dice manipulation) or experience (item & skill capacity). The idea being to survive 3 floors while picking up the right mix and quantity of rewards to defeat the boss on the fourth floor.
Near perfect implimentatioons. Tracking the Campaign is smooth. Have played almost 20 times in 2 days
Like the game except that I can only equip one item on all levels

Addictive. But loses a star because not all character powerups work. For 
instance, I powered up the warrior to have the ability to reroll yellow 1s 
and 2s during combat. I filled all the dots on the powerup card. However it 
isn't letting me do that during gameplay.
replyContent: Hi John, thanks for playing! A hero can only use one focus at a time from their progression checklist. Tap the focus to toggle it before starting the game to access your new ability.

content:
I had One Deck Dungeon in its cards and dice version. This is a perfect 
port, and it is super addictive! I want to complete the sheets of all 
classes! The game is hard enough for you to fail some times, but not 
punishing at all.

Great game but after a few days, I started experiencing the "rare black 
screen on startup" bug. *On Kindle Fire HD 10* Still gave 5 stars because I 
still have it on Steam and it's a great game. # Update# Seems to work just 
fine now. Thanks for the response. This game is challenging and fun. Takes 
about 30 to 40min per dungeon deck. The only downside is that the deck does 
get a little repetitive after a while. In the deck you will only encounter 
obstacles (traps), and enemies. It would be nice to see Events with various 
character or dungeon effects, and maybe a valuable Treasure Chest here and 
there. The all female character thing is a little odd too, but the game is 
still great. If consider removing the pre-built fixed gender and let the 
player choose. However, this is the adaptation of the card game so I doubt 
the developer has any changes or updates I mind. I look forward to other 
developers who might take these concepts and run with it.
replyContent: Great to hear you're back in action, and thanks for updating your review!

content:
I love the card game but dice placement is so glitchy it is frustrating. 
Not sure why but many times the dice are offset to not even be on the 
square blocking view of what you have left. For the cost I expect better
replyContent:
Hi Kendra, 
If dice are not locking into a box, make sure there aren't any uncovered armor boxes. You cannot cover a non-armor box until all armor boxes are covered. If you are sure you've dealt with all armor and are still having trouble, please contact us at support@handelabra.com so we can help figure out what's going on. Thanks!

content:
This is a great adaptation of the board game. Basically it is a rogue like 
dungeon crawl where you roll dice to over come encounters. Sounds simple, 
but it's not. There are items that give you more dice. You can use potions 
and skills to adjust you rolls. It is all about building a combinations to 
create a character that can beat the boss waiting for you at the end. You 
will not master this game the first time you play, but what fun would it be 
if you did. Overall steep learning curve, but we'll worth the time invested.

Definitely a solid game. The learning curve is a bit steep, and as someone 
else mentioned, the tutorial leaves you with quite a bit still unexplained, 
but several games in I'm finally beginning to feel more comfortable. I 
still don't understand everything, and there's a lot of trial and error, 
but I look at it as part of the roguelike experience of learning the game's 
ropes. I do think there is quite a bit of depth and replayability in using 
different characters in each dungeon, unlocking their skills, and trying 
different strategies, so if I manage to stick with the game long enough to 
truly feel I understand it, it will probably be on my device forever. Just 
beware the learning curve.
Great digital version of a great game.
A great adaptation of the card game.
